scope CSS doesnâ€™t support has selector with classes
Throws a module error

Hello <@UDJV5B73R>,
You can use {{ name }} with the parent class, and then include the .{{ name }} with your existing class in your CSS outside of scope. This approach always works for me.
Just reporting the bug, but thanks

Hi everyone. In design tools I have one css file which I would like to link to other page (Wordpress). Is there a way how can I get public URL of this file? The only way I know is to get public URL is via hubl `get_asset_url('main.css')` which of course is not possible on my wordpress page.
